main event: A witness reported seeing a very bright, solid, light gray object shaped like a boomerang in Norton, Connecticut on January 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object was approximately 100 feet across and 25 feet thick., The witness estimated the object's speed at around 10,000 miles per hour., The sighting lasted 0 seconds as the object was seen briefly., The witness was a physicist with advanced training in physical chemistry., The preliminary analysis suggested it could have been a meteor of unusual size and brightness.
sighted object: a bright light gray boomerang-shaped object
witness description: The witness was a physicist employed at a planetarium.
